title: on me by sections 5 and 11 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Requirement to
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Requirement to 

have Audible Warning Devices on Vehicles) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 1 January 2021.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited road traffic (requirement audible warning device vehicles) regulation 2020 (2) regulation come operation 1 january 2021

title: on me by sections 5 and 11 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and
heading: 2. Sub-article (5) of Article 28 of the Road Traffic (Construction,
text_raw:
2. Sub-article (5) of Article 28 of the Road Traffic (Construction, 
Equipment and Use of Vehicles) Regulations 1963 (S.I. No. 190 of 1963) is 
amended - 

(a) by the substitution of the following definition for the definition 

of “Irish Coast Guard vehicle”: 

“‘Irish Coast Guard vehicle’ means a mechanically propelled 
vehicle registered by the Irish Coast Guard under section 131 of 
the Finance Act 1992 (No. 9 of 1992);”, 

(b) by the deletion of the definition of “senior manager in the Irish 

Coast Guard”, and 

(c) 

in the definition of “Marked Military Police vehicle”, by the 
substitution of “.”for “;”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

15 December, 2020. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 29th December, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [638] 3

title: on me by sections 5 and 11 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These regulations amend the statutory provisions relating to audible warning 
devices by amending the definition of ‘Irish Coast Guard vehicle’ and deleting 
the definition of ‘senior manager in the Irish Coast Guard’. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [638]
